Title: On the Performance of Physically Constrained Multi-Pair Two-Way Massive MIMO Relaying with Zero Forcing
Source: IEEE Int Symp Person Indoor Mobile Radio Commun PIMRC
Abstract: © 2019 IEEE.In this paper, we consider a physically constrained multi-pair two-way massive multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) decode-and-forward (DF) half-duplex relay system, where multiple single-antenna user pairs exchange information through a massive MIMO relay, and we employ zero-forcing reception/zero-forcing transmission (ZFR/ZFT) at the relay. When the number of relay antennas M becomes very large and tends to be infinite, we study the large-scale approximation of the sum spectral efficiency (SE) with the effect of spatial correlation generated by the constrained space. Furthermore, we investigate the energy efficiency (EE) with a practical power consumption model, and demonstrate the impact of the relay antenna number and the size of constrained space on the EE performance.
